title: Why do people who know they have a shit PC/connection still play
body: I mean they know they are gonna ruin the game for 4 other people why do they still play?

replies.body: Because they think they don't need a stable internet connection to play a game that requires a stable internet connection.

How many of you whiny tools are australian based and played when there were no oceanic servers? From the sounds of it, all of none of you. If any oif you had been, this thread wouldn't exist, because oh did the lag spikes suck hard back then, but no real complaints.

Get the sticks out of your backsides, man up, and adapt to game play as it comes. If the players' internet connection is so horribad then they won't be in the upper ranks of ranked play so what's your issue? Oh wait, a whole mess of low ranked players who as a result aren't all that great %%%%%ing because dear gods they think them and them alone have the right to play one of the biggest free to play e-sports games out there. Man up or stfu. It's not hard. there's a Summoner's Code afterall and right now the vast majority of people posting here have forgotten it and have adopted a high horse self righteous %%%%ery stance. Well Played.

> [{quoted}](name=HVZ Watch Tower,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=mrrHIvpX,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2015-02-01T08:06:06.274+0000)
>
> How many of you whiny tools are australian based and played when there were no oceanic servers?

Pretty much every GDer from the forums, including myself. Thing is pretty much none of us had consistent/constant connection issues playing on other servers, the problem was relatively high ping, which was manageable. Hell even my friend, who got me into the game, has a good enough internet connection to play on other servers, and it's a pretty cr*p connection. The issue we are discussing here is that people should have a stable internet connection to play a game that requires a stable internet connection, not that anyone with the slightest connection issues shouldn't play.

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=mrrHIvpX,comment-id=000c0000,timestamp=2015-02-01T09:06:24.122+0000)
>
> Pretty much every GDer from the forums, including myself. Thing is pretty much none of us had consistent/constant connection issues playing on other servers, the problem was relatively high ping, which was manageable. Hell even my friend, who got me into the game, has a good enough internet connection to play on other servers, and it's a pretty cr*p connection. The issue we are discussing here is that people should have a stable internet connection to play a game that requires a stable internet connection, not that anyone with the slightest connection issues shouldn't play.

This is what I'd say too **High Ping =/= Unstable internet** I can play on NA servers with constant 200 ping this doesn't mean I disconnect or anything of the like I am just left with a slight delay that is easily adjusted to. What I am talking about in this post is not people with a bit of lag but people who disconnect regularly for significant amounts of time and still play knowing this which is basically the same as afking in my opinion.

We;re Aussies with as a whole sh itty internet and a government that still wants to put us back into copper piping speeds where South Korea is projected to have 1 GB a second dl inside the next few years. People who drop out ingame consistently - BLOCK THEM. It ain't hard. Surrender the game early if it's such an issue and move on. As i said, if they have such consistent issues they shouldn't be highly ranked so ranked games you should be fine on, outside of that it's all fun any ways so chill out and move on.
Shiet pc doesn't matter all that much since this game pretty much run on most if not all potatoes, the problem is people playing with shiet nets.

> [{quoted}](name=SEKAI,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=mrrHIvpX,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-01-31T13:58:40.512+0000)
>
> Shiet pc doesn't matter all that much since this game pretty much run on most if not all potatoes, the problem is people playing with shiet nets.

I am not talking about shiet PC in the way of "Oh my PC has a 2-3 year old graphics card" I am talking about those people who say things like "Sorry my PC always crashes/overheats" right after they connect 30 minutes into the game.

That's prob due to bad maintenance, cache overflow or something or might just because he visited too much nude sites and don't scan the computer often. Dunno.

Or maybe it's Mac client I have heard it's very unstable these days in the recent patches.
If u have %%%% PC turn down the graphics its fine. This game doesnt need anything to run.
The entire Australian internet is %%%%.
This game was made for everyone to play if your mad about it go play CoD

> [{quoted}](name=Mar3thyu,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=mrrHIvpX,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-02-01T01:54:47.449+0000)
>
> This game was made for everyone **with a stable internet connection** to play if your mad about it go play CoD

Fixed.

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=mrrHIvpX,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2015-02-01T02:19:40.264+0000)
>
> Fixed.

but what if you have stable internet 99% of the time but every so often your internet decides to drop it can't be helped

When I say stable I mean it can't be consistently/constantly cutting out, like something that would cause someone to DC in a significant amount of games. My internet is probably only stable 99% of the time, in fact I'd argue that any internet connection isn't stable 100% of the time.

I can honestly say I have never disconnected from the middle of a game because of my internet dropping. I have been unable to connect to a game at the start because of the firewall bullshiet however but I think that happens to everyone.

> [{quoted}](name=Mar3thyu,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=mrrHIvpX,comment-id=000800000000,timestamp=2015-02-01T06:23:25.474+0000)
>
> but what if you have stable internet 99% of the time but every so often your internet decides to drop it can't be helped

Happens that my net is just %%%% sometimes. When it happens in the middle of a game it can't be helped, but I make sure my net is working fine before I enter a game if it has messed up, even if it was an hour ago.
No, this is a competitive game, if you cant have a stable connection to play the game then you shouldn't play the game because it ruins it for 4 other people.

> [{quoted}](name=NigguhDamus,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=mrrHIvpX,comment-id=00080001,timestamp=2015-02-01T02:24:35.465+0000)
>
> No, this is a competitive game, if you cant have a stable connection to play the game then you shouldn't play the game because it ruins it for 4 other people.

This, the people with the unstable connections should be the ones to go play another game it may suck not being able to play LoL but if the cost of someone playing it is consistently ruining 4 other peoples games they should find another to play till they fix their net.
so they can ruin the game for 4 other people

I have a %%%%ty mac


And i still play.

And still don't ruined for the other 4.
FOR THE GREATER GOOD
these people are what you call assholes

Pfft I've been playing its around 700 ping since the start for about half a year before I switched my internet and it stopped working. If you learn to deal with the lag it isn't actually that hard to play, just a mere inconvinience. There are often symptoms before one crashes, and reconnecting to the Internet in time often fixes it. That's what happened for me anyways.
They don't care that they ruin the game for others.

The age-old conundrum.
Its just frustrating to play on a bad connection, so I too wonder why people willingly put themselves through it.
you mad that you're losing a video game?

> [{quoted}](name=WEETBIX 4 BREKKI,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=mrrHIvpX,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-01-31T12:53:52.913+0000)
>
> you mad that you're losing a video game?

love that I'm getting downvoted, stay bronze lads
